description: Construction of three storey dwellinghouse (following demolition of existing single storey garage/outbuilding) fronting onto Mount Pleasant Road
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). 	 | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):

LP REV A (Location Plan), CP REV A (context plan), 100 REV A (coloured site layout), 101 REV A (information site layout), 103 REV A (proposed elevations), 104 REV A (proposed street scene), 105 (site sections) & 202 (proposed floor plans)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form, and Planning Design and Access Statement, and carried out in accordance with the approved drawings as listed in condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of The London Plan (Consolidated 2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013). | Two (2) cycle storage spaces shall be provided for the new dwellinghouse. Such provision shall be brought to use prior to the occupation of the development and retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and the London Plan (2016) policy 5.16.	 | Refuse and recycling storage areas shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate refuse storage in accordance with policy 5.16 of the London Plan 2016.	 | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A - H of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, no permitted development shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure orderly development, in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2 (f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, Plan for the Environment (2004). | Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a construction management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. Details shall include control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 hrs on Saturdays, advance notification to neighbours and other interested parties of proposed works and public display of contact details including accessible phone contact to persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with  policies 1.1 (e) (j) 1.2 (f), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13,  7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise | Notwithstanding the information shown on the approved plans, further details of the hard and soft landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development.  All detailed works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of the premises. Such details shall include: provision of planting along rear boundary, provision of planting in forecourt & provision of one off-street parking space, the defined points of access and any new surfacing materials to be used.

Reason: To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening and to ensure that the off-street parking does not prejudice pedestrian safety and in the interests of providing a sustainable environment for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.9, 6.11, 6.13, 7.4, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); The London Environment Strategy (2018); and policies 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 5dBA as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises, in order to prevent any adverse impact. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies7.15 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | No part of the roof of the building hereby approved shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2016), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | The residential unit hereby approved shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | All side-facing windows of the hereby approved development shall contain only obscure glass and only have top openings at a minimum of 1.7 metres from floor level.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 7.4, 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), policies Local variation to policy 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1, 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012). | Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq.
Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the units and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | Any planting that is part of the approved scheme that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season and all planting shall be replaced with others of a similar size and species and in the same position, unless the Local Planning Authority first gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening and to ensure that the off-street parking does not prejudice pedestrian safety and in the interests of providing a sustainable environment for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.9, 6.11, 6.13, 7.4, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); The London Environment Strategy (2018); and policies 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) used during the course of the development that is within the scope of the Greater London Authority 'Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition' Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) dated July 2014, or any subsequent amendment or guidance, shall comply with the emission requirements therein.

Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016). | The vehicle parking arrangements of the approved scheme shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose. No additional car parking shall be formed or made available except with the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening and to ensure that the off-street parking does not prejudice pedestrian safety and in the interests of providing a sustainable environment for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.9, 6.11, 6.13, 7.4, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); The London Environment Strategy (2018); and policies 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
